original: rdo rje'i 'jig rten dbang phyug ni gdon mi za bar grub ba'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sprul pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i 'jig rten dbang phyug ni gdon mi za bar grub ba'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi sprul pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The Vajra Lord of the World is the emanation of the Lord of the World in the abode of the Accomplished One.

original: de'i dngos grub ni gang yin pa de yang mchog ste de yang sbyin pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i dngos grub ni gang yin pa de yang mchog ste de yang sbyin pa'o ;
translated: His power is the supreme, and that is also given.

original: / de'i gnas kyi phyag rgya gang yin pa de la padmo 'dod pa zhes bshad de las sna tshogs pas sems can thams cad mgu bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de'i gnas kyi phyag rgya gang yin pa de la padmo 'dod pa zhes bshad de las sna tshogs pas sems can thams cad mgu bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mudra of his abode is called the Lotus Desire, because it pleases all beings with its various actions.

original: sangs rgyas dbang ni rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas su sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgyar sprul pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dbang ni rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas su sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgyar sprul pa ste /
translated: The Buddha Empowerment is the emanation of the Buddha mudra in the abode of Vajrasattva.

original: de bcings shing bsgoms na sangs rgyas pa nyid sbyin par byed de rdo rje padmo ni rdo rje rgyal po'i gnas su ste des dngos grub mchog sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de bcings shing bsgoms na sangs rgyas pa nyid sbyin par byed de rdo rje padmo ni rdo rje rgyal po'i gnas su ste des dngos grub mchog sbyin par byed do //
translated: Binding and meditating on that, it gives the empowerment of Buddhahood. The Vajra Lotus is in the abode of Vajraraja, and it gives the supreme power.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang po ni bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang po ni bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug ste /
translated: The Lord of Desire is the Lord of the World, the Bhagavat.

original: rdo rje chags pa'i gzugs su bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje chags pa'i gzugs su bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He resides in the form of Vajra Passion.

original: de'i phyag rgya bcings na rab 'dod ldan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya bcings na rab 'dod ldan zhes bya ste /
translated: If one binds the seal of that, it is called “having excellent desire.”

original: chags pa bzang po la ldan pas na rab 'dod ldan no //
analyzed: chags pa bzang po la ldan pas na rab 'dod ldan no //
translated: Since it is endowed with excellent attachment, it has excellent desire.

original: de yang sems can smin pa dang grol bar byed pa'i chags pa ste chags pa des chags pa'i phyir rab 'dod do //
analyzed: de yang sems can smin pa dang grol bar byed pa'i chags pa ste chags pa des chags pa'i phyir rab 'dod do //
translated: Moreover, it is attachment that ripens and liberates sentient beings. Since one is attached to that attachment, it has excellent desire.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na rab 'dod ldan no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na rab 'dod ldan no //
translated: Since it has that nature, it has excellent desire.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: 'khor ba na 'khor zhing srog gi mthar gtugs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis kyang sems can rnams kyi don bya ba mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba na 'khor zhing srog gi mthar gtugs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis kyang sems can rnams kyi don bya ba mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Even though one cycles in samsara and is at the end of one’s life, one does not abandon working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de yang ji skad du /🔽gzhan don brtse ba can rnams srog phyir yang /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du / gzhan don brtse ba can rnams srog phyir yang /
translated: Moreover, it is as stated:🔽Those who are loving for the sake of others

original: rang gi nus pa lhod par mi byed de //🔽skyes bu dam pa khur lci khur bdag /
analyzed: rang gi nus pa lhod par mi byed de // skyes bu dam pa khur lci khur bdag /
translated: do not relax their own ability even for the sake of their life.🔽Noble beings do not abandon

original: nyam nga'i lam du'ang 'dor bar mi byed do //
analyzed: nyam nga'i lam du'ang 'dor bar mi byed do //
translated: even a heavy burden or the path of hardship.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is taught:

original: dga' ba yis ni legs par sbyin //
analyzed: dga' ba yis ni legs par sbyin //
translated: One gives well with joy.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje legs pa'i gnas kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje legs pa'i gnas kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the seal of the abode of Vajrasādhu.

original: khro gnyer gyi ni khro zhi 'gyur //
analyzed: khro gnyer gyi ni khro zhi 'gyur //
translated: The frown pacifies the wrathful.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje rin chen gyi gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug khro gnyer can lta bur sprul pas na khro gnyer zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje rin chen gyi gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug khro gnyer can lta bur sprul pas na khro gnyer zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is the emanation of Akṣobhya in the place of Vajraratna, as Amokṣa, the wrathful form of Lokeśvara.

original: de ni khro zhing 'gyur zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni khro zhing 'gyur zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called the “frowning one”🔽because he is wrathful,

original: gang gi phyir khro bo thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khro bo thams cad bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to avert all wrathful ones.

original: @37b bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug gis de sprul pa yin no //
analyzed: @37b bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug gis de sprul pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed Lord Lokeśvara emanated him.

original: de bas na de bsgoms na khro bo thams cad zhi zhing sel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de bsgoms na khro bo thams cad zhi zhing sel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when he is meditated upon, all wrath is pacified and removed.

original: padmo'i nyi ma ni rdo rje nyi ma'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gis sprul ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa ste de bsgoms na gzi brjid mchog sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: padmo'i nyi ma ni rdo rje nyi ma'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gis sprul ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa ste de bsgoms na gzi brjid mchog sbyin pa ste /
translated: The lotus sun is the essence of the emanation of Lokeśvara in the place of Vajrasūrya. When he is meditated upon, he bestows the gift of supreme splendor.

original: gzi brjid nyi ma stong bas lhag / ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid nyi ma stong bas lhag / ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, “Splendor surpassing a thousand suns.”

original: padmo'i zla ba ni rdo rje dpal gyi gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya zla ba'i gzugs su sprul pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: padmo'i zla ba ni rdo rje dpal gyi gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya zla ba'i gzugs su sprul pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The moon of the lotus is the moon-form emanation of the seal of Lokeśvara in the abode of Vajraśrī.

original: de bcings shing bsgoms nas mdangs chen po sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bcings shing bsgoms nas mdangs chen po sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having bound and meditated on that, one will obtain the bestowal of great splendor.

original: bzhad mo'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: bzhad mo'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: The seal of Lokeśvara in the abode of the smile is the seal of Lokeśvara in the abode of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.

original: des rab tu bzhad pa nyid 'thob par byed de /
analyzed: des rab tu bzhad pa nyid 'thob par byed de /
translated: By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.

original: chos rab tu zab mo rtogs par gyur pa des rab tu dga' bar gyur pa dang / des 'dzum pa'i khyad par ston pa 'di ni bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu zab mo rtogs par gyur pa des rab tu dga' bar gyur pa dang / des 'dzum pa'i khyad par ston pa 'di ni bzhad pa'o //
translated: By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na bzhad pa nyid de de thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na bzhad pa nyid de de thob par byed pa'o //
translated: By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.

original: sgrol ma 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya spyan gyi 'bras bu las byung nas gnas pa de ni sgrol ba ste des ni dngos grub kyi mchog sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: sgrol ma 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya spyan gyi 'bras bu las byung nas gnas pa de ni sgrol ba ste des ni dngos grub kyi mchog sbyin par byed do //
translated: By that, one causes the attainment of the smile.🔽By that

original: padmo'i ral gri ni 'jam dpal gyi gzugs kyis de'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: padmo'i ral gri ni 'jam dpal gyi gzugs kyis de'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya gang yin pa'o //
translated: The lotus sword is the mudra of Avalokitesvara in the place of Manjusri.

original: de bcings shing sgoms na skal bzang 'thob par byed de /
analyzed: de bcings shing sgoms na skal bzang 'thob par byed de /
translated: When one binds and meditates on that, one causes the attainment of good fortune.

original: 'di ni 'di'i lam gyi gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i lam gyi gtso bo yin no //
translated: This is the principal path of that deity.

original: mgrin sngon gyis ni 'gugs pa che //
analyzed: mgrin sngon gyis ni 'gugs pa che //
translated: The blue-throated one is the great attractor.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje rgyu'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya khyab 'jug ga gzugs su sprul pa gang yin bde la mgrin sngon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje rgyu'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya khyab 'jug ga gzugs su sprul pa gang yin bde la mgrin sngon zhes bya'o //
translated: The blue-throated one is the mudra of Narayana, who is the emanation of Avalokitesvara in the place of Vajradharma.

original: de bcings na gtso cher 'gugs pa'i las byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bcings na gtso cher 'gugs pa'i las byed pa yin no //
translated: When one binds that, one performs the action of attraction.

original: gos dkar gyis ni dngos grub po //
analyzed: gos dkar gyis ni dngos grub po //
translated: The white-garbed one is the bestower of powers.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje smra ba'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya gos dkar mo'i gzugs su sprul pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje smra ba'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya gos dkar mo'i gzugs su sprul pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The white-garbed one is the mudra of Pandaravasini, who is the emanation of Avalokitesvara in the place of Vajra Speech.

original: gos dkar mo des spyir dngos grub yid du 'ong ba gang yang rung ba sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: gos dkar mo des spyir dngos grub yid du 'ong ba gang yang rung ba sbyin par byed do //
translated: That white-garbed one bestows any desirable power in general.

original: padmo gar gyi dbang phyug ni rdo rje las kyi gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi phyag rgya 'dzin par sprul cing gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: padmo gar gyi dbang phyug ni rdo rje las kyi gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs padma gar gyi dbang phyug gi phyag rgya 'dzin par sprul cing gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The Lotus Lord of Dance is the emanation and abiding of the form of Lokeshvara in the place of Vajrakarma, holding the mudra of the Lotus Lord of Dance.

original: de bcings na 'dod pa'i dngos grub sbyin par byed do //🔽mi 'jigs pa ni rdo rje bsrung ba'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs mi @38a * //
analyzed: de bcings na 'dod pa'i dngos grub sbyin par byed do // mi 'jigs pa ni rdo rje bsrung ba'i gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs mi @38a * //
translated: When it is bound, it grants the power of desire.

original: 'jigs pa'i phyag gi go cha'i phyag rgya rnam par sprul pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i phyag gi go cha'i phyag rgya rnam par sprul pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Fearlessness is the emanation of the form of Lokeshvara in the place of Vajravarma, the mudra of the armor of the hand of fearlessness.

original: de bcings na mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: de bcings na mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: When it is bound, it grants fearlessness.

original: 'jigs pa'i rnam pa thams cad sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i rnam pa thams cad sel bar byed do //
translated: It removes all forms of fear.

original: rab gtum ma ni rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs gdug pa thams cad skrag par mdzad pa'i gzugs su gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab gtum ma ni rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs gdug pa thams cad skrag par mdzad pa'i gzugs su gnas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The Fierce One is the form of Lokeshvara in the place of Vajyarakshasa, abiding in the form that terrifies all evildoers.

original: de ni gdug pa thams cad 'dul par byed pas na ma rungs pa 'dul zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ni gdug pa thams cad 'dul par byed pas na ma rungs pa 'dul zhes bshad do //
translated: Since it subdues all evildoers, it is called the subduer of the wicked.

original: padmo khu tshur rab sgrub byed //
analyzed: padmo khu tshur rab sgrub byed //
translated: The lotus fist is the supreme means of achievement.

original: ces bya ba ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya chen po padmo'i khu tshur bcings te bzhugs pas na padmo'i khu tshur zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi gnas kyi 'jig rten dbang phyug gi phyag rgya chen po padmo'i khu tshur bcings te bzhugs pas na padmo'i khu tshur zhes bya ste /
translated: The great seal of Lokeśvara in the position of the vajra fist is the lotus fist.

original: de bcings na lha thams cad kyis dgongs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bcings na lha thams cad kyis dgongs par 'gyur la /
translated: When it is bound, all gods think of it.

original: lha rnams kyis dgongs na 'dod pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis dgongs na 'dod pa'i don 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: When the gods think of it, the desired aim is accomplished.

original: de bas na /🔽padmo'i khu tshur rab sgrub byed //
analyzed: de bas na / padmo'i khu tshur rab sgrub byed //
translated: Therefore,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: the lotus fist is the supreme means of achievement.

original: l'a syas dga' zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgeg mo'i phyag rgya bcings shing bsgoms na dga' ba sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: l'a syas dga' zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sgeg mo'i phyag rgya bcings shing bsgoms na dga' ba sbyin par byed do //
translated: The seal of Lāsyā, when bound and meditated upon, bestows joy.

original: de bzhin du phreng ba ni rin po che'i phreng ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du phreng ba ni rin po che'i phreng ba ste /
translated: Similarly, the garland is a precious garland.

original: de rang gi lha'i rnal 'phyor gyis bcings shing bsgoms la /
analyzed: de rang gi lha'i rnal 'phyor gyis bcings shing bsgoms la /
translated: When it is bound and meditated upon with the yoga of one's deity,

original: rang ngam sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la mchod na des nor sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: rang ngam sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la mchod na des nor sbyin par byed do //
translated: If one makes offerings to oneself or to other buddhas and bodhisattvas, they will give one wealth.

original: glu ma'i phyag rgya chen po dbyangs sgrogs pa'i tshul du ston pa de bcings shing bsgoms na tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyi bar du dbyangs rim gyis sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: glu ma'i phyag rgya chen po dbyangs sgrogs pa'i tshul du ston pa de bcings shing bsgoms na tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyi bar du dbyangs rim gyis sbyin par byed do //
translated: If one binds and meditates on the great seal of the songstress, who is the method of proclaiming melody, one will gradually be given melody up to the melody of Brahma.

original: gar gyi phyag rgya chen po bcings shing bsgoms na mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba bla na med pa la thug gi bar gyi bde ba rnams rim gyis sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: gar gyi phyag rgya chen po bcings shing bsgoms na mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba bla na med pa la thug gi bar gyi bde ba rnams rim gyis sbyin par byed do //
translated: If one binds and meditates on the great seal of dance, one will gradually be given all forms of bliss up to the unsurpassed bliss of nirvana.

original: bdug pa'i lha mo chen mo'i phyag rgya chen po bcings shing bsgoms na tshim par sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdug pa'i lha mo chen mo'i phyag rgya chen po bcings shing bsgoms na tshim par sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one binds and meditates on the great seal of the great incense goddess, one will be given satisfaction.

original: 'di skad ston te ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba sbyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te ting nge 'dzin mngon du gyur pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba sbyin par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught: the bliss of pliancy that is in harmony with the actualization of meditative concentration will be given.

original: tshim par 'gyur na lus dang sems rtsub pa dang bral bas lus dang sems shin tu spangs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshim par 'gyur na lus dang sems rtsub pa dang bral bas lus dang sems shin tu spangs par 'gyur la /
translated: If one is satisfied, then one is free from the coarseness of body and mind, and so one attains the lightness of body and mind.

original: des ni dngos po gang brtsams pa la ldang pa yang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni dngos po gang brtsams pa la ldang pa yang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And one is able to rise up from any position.

original: mar me'i phyag rgya chen po bcings shing bsgoms na mar me'i snang ba'i tshul du ring zhing phra ba la gnas pa'i don rnams la yang skyu ru ra lag mthil du bzhag pa bzhin du ye shes skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mar me'i phyag rgya chen po bcings shing bsgoms na mar me'i snang ba'i tshul du ring zhing phra ba la gnas pa'i don rnams la yang skyu ru ra lag mthil du bzhag pa bzhin du ye shes skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one forms the mudra of the lamp and meditates on it, then, like the appearance of a lamp, one generates the intuition that is like a myrobalan fruit placed in the palm of the hand, even with regard to distant and subtle objects.

original: @38b dri'i lha mo'i phyag rgya chen po bcings shing bsgoms na lus la tsandan dang autpala sogs pa'i dri sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @38b dri'i lha mo'i phyag rgya chen po bcings shing bsgoms na lus la tsandan dang autpala sogs pa'i dri sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one forms the mudra of the goddess of fragrance and meditates on it, one will emit the fragrance of sandalwood, blue lotus, and so on from one’s body.

original: rta mgrin gyi phyag rgya chen po bsgoms na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa sems dpa' thams cad 'gugs pa'i dgos pa thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rta mgrin gyi phyag rgya chen po bsgoms na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa sems dpa' thams cad 'gugs pa'i dgos pa thams cad byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one meditates on the mudra of Hayagriva, one will accomplish all the purposes of summoning all the heroes, such as the Tathagatas.

original: gdon mi za ba ni don yod pa ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za ba ni don yod pa ste /
translated: “Unfailing” means “successful.”

original: dbang du bya ba'i las la byams pa'i zhags pas dbang du mdzad pas na dbang du byed ces bshad do //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba'i las la byams pa'i zhags pas dbang du mdzad pas na dbang du byed ces bshad do //
translated: The activity of enthralling is explained as enthralling by the noose of love.

original: lcags sgrog 'ching ba yin pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: lcags sgrog 'ching ba yin pa'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the fetter-binding is explained.

original: padma'i rigs kyi lcags sgrog yin pas na padmo'i lcags sgrog go //
analyzed: padma'i rigs kyi lcags sgrog yin pas na padmo'i lcags sgrog go //
translated: Since it is the fetter of the lotus family, it is the lotus fetter.

original: 'di bcings na mngon par 'dod pa'i don thams cad 'ching bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di bcings na mngon par 'dod pa'i don thams cad 'ching bar byed do //
translated: When this is bound, it binds all desired objects.

original: dril bu'i phyag rgyas ni sems dpa' thams cad 'bebs par byed de /
analyzed: dril bu'i phyag rgyas ni sems dpa' thams cad 'bebs par byed de /
translated: The bell gesture causes all heroes to descend.

original: sngags dang sbyor ba dang ldan na thams cad 'bebs par bshad do //
analyzed: sngags dang sbyor ba dang ldan na thams cad 'bebs par bshad do //
translated: When it is applied with the mantra, it is explained as causing all to descend.

analyzed: mthe'u chung mthe bo phye ba ni //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

translated: The thumbs and little fingers are extended, and the four petals are made to face outward. This is called “the little fingers and thumbs are extended.”

analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das 'gro ba 'dul ba dgod pa'i phyag rgya'o //

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo'o //

original: mthe bo gnyis bsnol te zhes bya ba ni gang gi mthe bo gnyis rdo rje bsdoms pa dang 'dra bar skyil mo krung gi tshul du byas pa de ni mthe bo @40b gnyis bsnol ba'o //
analyzed: mthe bo gnyis bsnol te zhes bya ba ni gang gi mthe bo gnyis rdo rje bsdoms pa dang 'dra bar skyil mo krung gi tshul du byas pa de ni mthe bo @40b gnyis bsnol ba'o //

original: mdzub mo gnyis rtse sprad bkug pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba ni gang gi mdzub mo gnyis kyi rtse mo sprad la bkug pa'i dbyibs de ni mdzub mo bkug pa'i gzugs so //

translated: The two index fingers touching, bent, means that the two index fingers touch and are bent in the shape of a hook.

original: dbus kyi rdo rje spyi gtsug phud //
analyzed: dbus kyi rdo rje spyi gtsug phud //

original: ces bya ba ni gung mo'i sor mo gnyis rdo rje'i tshul du byas pa ni gtsug phud du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gung mo'i sor mo gnyis rdo rje'i tshul du byas pa ni gtsug phud du 'gyur te /

analyzed: de nas spyi gtsug tu bzhag na /

analyzed: gtsug phud sangs rgyas yin par bshad //

original: ces bya ste gtsug phud sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ba ni rdo rje rin chen gyi gnas su phyag rgya de bcings na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes bya'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ste gtsug phud sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ba ni rdo rje rin chen gyi gnas su phyag rgya de bcings na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o zhes bya'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The mudra called crest buddha is formed by binding that mudra in the place of the vajra jewel.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje bsdams pa dam du bcings la rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe bo gnyis thad kar bzhag pa de las kyang khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mthe bo bsnyams te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje bsdams pa dam du bcings la rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe bo gnyis thad kar bzhag pa de las kyang khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mthe bo bsnyams te zhes bya ba smos so //

original: bsnyams nas ji ltar gzhag par bya zhen /
analyzed: bsnyams nas ji ltar gzhag par bya zhen /

original: btud nas ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: btud nas ni zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: mthe bo gnyis kyi rtser mdzub mo bkug pa dang rtse sprad par bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar bcings nas phyag rgya de ji ltar gzhag par bya zhe na /

analyzed: bkan nas zhes bya ba gsungs so // ci bye brag de tsam du zad dam /

original: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin du gzhag ces bya ba gsungs so //

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi chos kyi dkyil 'khor du ting nge 'dzin gyi skyil mo krung gi steng du bkan la brkyang ste bzhag pas ji ltar gsungs pa de bzhin du 'dir yang de dang 'dra bar khong du chud par bya'o //

translated: One should understand that it is just like the explanation in the Vajradhātu Dharma-maṇḍala, where it says, “Having extended the legs in the vajra posture of meditative concentration, one should place them.”

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du gzhag ces bya ba 'dis ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i gnas su dgod pa'i phyag rgya'o // thal mo padmor mnyam sbyar la //
translated: “One should enter into meditative concentration” means the mudrā for placing in the abode of Amitābha.🔽“Having joined the palms in the lotus” and so forth.

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thal mo mnyam pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdo rje thal mo lta bur bya ba 'gog pa yin no //

analyzed: mnyam sbyar la zhes bya ba ni bcing ba'o //

original: mdzub mo rdo rje bsnyams nas ni //
analyzed: mdzub mo rdo rje bsnyams nas ni //

analyzed: mthe bo gnyis kyi ngos kyang phral zhing phye ste gzhag go //

analyzed: de lta bu'i phyag rgya 'di su zhig gi yin zhe na /

original: des pa'i dbang phyug ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: des pa'i dbang phyug ces bya ba ste /

original: gi'o // 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: gi'o // 'di skad ston te /

analyzed: gang gdon mi za bar grub pa'i gnas na bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug de'i dgod pa'i phyag rgya ni 'di yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of the Lord of the World who resides in the abode of certain attainment.

analyzed: da ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gnas su sangs rgyas la sogs pa dgod pa'i phyag rgya ni /

original: rdo rje bsdams pa bsdams nas ni //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa bsdams nas ni //
translated: beginning with “Having bound the vajra binding,”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: and so forth.

original: legs par bkan te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: legs par bkan te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having well extended” means

analyzed: skyil mo krung gi steng du rdo rje bsdams pa bkan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: Then, from the extended vajra-binding, the two thumbs are extended and placed together, and from that they are made like lotus petals. This is the seal of the abode of Vajrasattva.

analyzed: 'di'i ming ji skad du bya ba yin zhe na /

analyzed: sangs rgyas padmo yin par bshad //

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: mthe bo bkug nas ni zhes bya ba ni mthe bo bkug nas so //
translated: bending means bending the thumbs.

analyzed: des ci zhig bya zhen /

analyzed: mdzub mos mdzub mo bzung nas su //

analyzed: ci zhig bya zhen /

translated: The two little fingers are spread apart, not touching each other, and extended.

original: 'di'i ming ji skad du bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i ming ji skad du bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the name of this seal?

original: padmo khro gnyer zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: padmo khro gnyer zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is called the lotus frown.

original: sor mo thams cad dkyil 'khor du ;
analyzed: sor mo thams cad dkyil 'khor du ;
translated: All the fingers are in a circle.

original: / zhes bya ba ni shing tu brkyang pa'i don te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni shing tu brkyang pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that they are extended.

original: padma'i nyi ma'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: padma'i nyi ma'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the seal of the lotus sun.

original: dpung pa spyi bor rab brkyang ba //
analyzed: dpung pa spyi bor rab brkyang ba //
translated: The shoulders are extended at the crown.🔽In this way, the shoulders are extended upward at the crown of the head.

original: zhes bya ba la dpung pa gnyis spyi bo'i tha dkar gyen du brkyang na de lta bu ni padmo'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtser gyur pa yin no //🔽padmo'i rin chen rgyal mtshan rtse //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dpung pa gnyis spyi bo'i tha dkar gyen du brkyang na de lta bu ni padmo'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtser gyur pa yin no // padmo'i rin chen rgyal mtshan rtse //
translated: This is the top of the lotus victory banner.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya'i ming @42a * //🔽ston pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya'i ming @42a * // ston pa yin no //
translated: This is the name of the mudra.🔽The vajra fist is placed at the crown.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa spyi bor bzhag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la spyi bo ste mtshog ma'i gnas gtsug tor gyi sar brkyang ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa spyi bor bzhag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la spyi bo ste mtshog ma'i gnas gtsug tor gyi sar brkyang ste /
translated: The crown is the place of the uṣṇīṣa at the top of the head.🔽The ten fingers of the vajra fist are extended upward.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa'i sor mo bcu char gyen du bstan te brkyang la sor mo'i rtse mo gang dang gang yin pa de dang de rnams mgo bo she ngag tu bsams la /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa'i sor mo bcu char gyen du bstan te brkyang la sor mo'i rtse mo gang dang gang yin pa de dang de rnams mgo bo she ngag tu bsams la /
translated: The tips of the fingers are imagined to be the uṣṇīṣa.

original: nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rang gi mgo bos bgad cing hah zhes shas cher bgad na nyid kyi kha dgod pa dang bcas na rdo rje bzhad pa'i phyag rgya kha bcu gcig pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i rang gi mgo bos bgad cing hah zhes shas cher bgad na nyid kyi kha dgod pa dang bcas na rdo rje bzhad pa'i phyag rgya kha bcu gcig pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ro /
translated: If one laughs with one's own head, which is the natural abode of one's own nature, and laughs greatly with ha ha, then, with one's own smile, it is the mudra of Vajra Laughter, called the eleven-faced one.

original: ting 'dzin pad mo bcings nas ni //
analyzed: ting 'dzin pad mo bcings nas ni //
translated: Having bound the samadhi lotus,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ting nge 'dzin padmo ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ting nge 'dzin padmo ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i gnas su'o //
translated: etc. The samadhi lotus is in the abode of Amitabha.

original: mthe bo gnyis ni so sor gyed //
analyzed: mthe bo gnyis ni so sor gyed //
translated: The two thumbs are extended.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Etc. has been explained.

original: mthe bo de gnyis gcig la gcig lto sbrang par bya ste /
analyzed: mthe bo de gnyis gcig la gcig lto sbrang par bya ste /
translated: Those two thumbs face each other, like the belly of a bee.

original: de ltar na padmo sgrol ba'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na padmo sgrol ba'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it becomes the mudra of the lotus-liberator.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnon po'i ni kho bo cag gis mthong ba'i glegs bam rnams las ma rnyed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnon po'i ni kho bo cag gis mthong ba'i glegs bam rnams las ma rnyed do //
translated: As for the Bhagavat Vajra Sharpness, it was not found in the scriptures that we saw.

original: mthe'u chung padmo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe'u chung gnyis padma kha ma bye ba'i tshul du byas pa zhes bya ba 'di ni padma chen po zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mthe'u chung padmo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe'u chung gnyis padma kha ma bye ba'i tshul du byas pa zhes bya ba 'di ni padma chen po zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The “lotus of the little fingers” and so forth: the two little fingers of the vajra-binding are in the shape of an unopened lotus. This is the great lotus mudra.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa de nyid kyi mthe bo gnyis gshibs nas rtse mo gyen du bstan la rtse mor byas pa ni gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa de nyid kyi mthe bo gnyis gshibs nas rtse mo gyen du bstan la rtse mor byas pa ni gnyis pa ste /
translated: The same vajra-binding, with the two thumbs side by side, the tips pointing upward, is the second.

original: dbyig pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dbyig pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mace mudra.

original: mdzub mo'i rtse mo bkug ste phan tshun rtse sbrang pa byas la /
analyzed: mdzub mo'i rtse mo bkug ste phan tshun rtse sbrang pa byas la /
translated: The tips of the index fingers are bent and touch each other.

original: kun nas 'khyil pa'i tshul du zlum por byas pa 'di ni gsum pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas 'khyil pa'i tshul du zlum por byas pa 'di ni gsum pa ste /
translated: They are made round in the shape of a complete circle. This is the third.

original: dung chen gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dung chen gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the great conch mudra.

original: gud mo srin lag 'khor lor sbyar zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bsdams pa byas la lhag ma gung mo dang srin lag gnyis rdo rje 'khor lo'i tshul du bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gud mo srin lag 'khor lor sbyar zhes bya ba ni rdo rje bsdams pa byas la lhag ma gung mo dang srin lag gnyis rdo rje 'khor lo'i tshul du bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The “ring and little fingers joined in a wheel” means that the vajra-binding is made, and the remaining middle and ring fingers are shown in the shape of a vajra wheel.

original: 'di ni rdo rje rgyu'i sngags las ji skad bshad pa'i phyag rgya bzhi bo yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje rgyu'i sngags las ji skad bshad pa'i phyag rgya bzhi bo yin no //
translated: These are the four seals explained in the Vajra Vehicle Mantra.

original: rdo rje thal mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for vajra palms, and so forth,

original: g-yas pa'i aom gyi nang du gzhug / ces bya ba ni mthe bo g-yon pa nang du bcug la mdzub mo g-yas pa bkug nas rang gi mthe bo dang gdong sprad pa ni aom gyi nang du gzhug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i aom gyi nang du gzhug / ces bya ba ni mthe bo g-yon pa nang du bcug la mdzub mo g-yas pa bkug nas rang gi mthe bo dang gdong sprad pa ni aom gyi nang du gzhug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the right [thumb] is inserted into the oṃ, means that the left thumb is inserted inside, and the right index finger is bent and touches one's thumb, which is called inserting into the 'oṃ.'

original: g-yon pa'i mthe bo dang mdzub mo yang de bzhin du bzhag la bzlas pa byed pa'i tshul bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i mthe bo dang mdzub mo yang de bzhin du bzhag la bzlas pa byed pa'i tshul bya'o //
translated: The left thumb and index finger are also placed like that, and the recitation method is performed.

original: sor mo lhag ma rnams gcig la gcig ma 'byar bar phral te rtse mo cung zad brkyang la rdo rje @42b thal mo nyid ma phye ba 'di ni chu skyes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sor mo lhag ma rnams gcig la gcig ma 'byar bar phral te rtse mo cung zad brkyang la rdo rje @42b thal mo nyid ma phye ba 'di ni chu skyes zhes bya ste /
translated: The remaining fingers are slightly spread apart without touching each other, and the tips are slightly extended. This vajra palm itself, without opening, is called the lotus.

original: 'di ni rdo rje smra ba'i gnas kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje smra ba'i gnas kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the seal of the abode of the vajra speech.

original: rdo rje thal mo mnyam sbyar la //
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo mnyam sbyar la //
translated: Joining the vajra palms together,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje thal mo bcings pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje thal mo bcings pa'o //
translated: and so forth, is the binding of the vajra palms.

original: g-yon dang g-yas nas zhes bya ba ni g-yas g-yon gyi ngos gnyis su rdo rje thal mo de nyid 'gying ba dang bcas par bskor ba'i tshul du byas la spyi bor gzhag go //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas nas zhes bya ba ni g-yas g-yon gyi ngos gnyis su rdo rje thal mo de nyid 'gying ba dang bcas par bskor ba'i tshul du byas la spyi bor gzhag go //
translated: The left and right means that one should place the vajra palms on one's crown, turning them in a manner of swaying to the right and left.

original: de nas yang bskor zhing drangs la ngos gang yang rung ba nas rdo rje thal mo de dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yang bskor zhing drangs la ngos gang yang rung ba nas rdo rje thal mo de dbab par bya'o //
translated: Then, turning again and drawing them, one should lower the vajra palms from whichever side.

original: de nas yang ngos gzhan nas slar bteg la ngos gcig tu dbab par bya zhing de bzhin du spyi bo'i bar du drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yang ngos gzhan nas slar bteg la ngos gcig tu dbab par bya zhing de bzhin du spyi bo'i bar du drang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, again raising them from the other side, one should lower them to one side, and in the same way draw them up to the crown.

original: 'gying bcas ni sgeg pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'gying bcas ni sgeg pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Swaying means with grace.

original: 'di ni gar thabs padmo can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gar thabs padmo can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is called the lotus dance method.

original: rdo rje las kyi gnas kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje las kyi gnas kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: It is the seal of the vajra karma abode.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdo rje thal mo ma bkrol bar ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdo rje thal mo ma bkrol bar ston to //
translated: The same indicates that one should not unclasp the vajra palms.

original: rtse mo kha bye ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo ma bkrol ba nyid du sor mo thams cad kyi rtse mo phral na sor mo thams cad kha bye ba yin no //
analyzed: rtse mo kha bye ba zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo ma bkrol ba nyid du sor mo thams cad kyi rtse mo phral na sor mo thams cad kha bye ba yin no //
translated: The so-called “summit opening” is the vajra-palms not opened, but with the tips of all the fingers spread, all the fingers are opened.

original: de lta bu'i rdo rje thal mo de bskor ba ni lag pa'i mthil gnyis rgyab sbrang pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdo rje thal mo de bskor ba ni lag pa'i mthil gnyis rgyab sbrang pa'o //
translated: The circling of such vajra-palms is the two palms facing each other.

original: de nas snying gar bzhag na padmos brtan par byed pa ste go cha'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas snying gar bzhag na padmos brtan par byed pa ste go cha'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then, when placed at the heart, it is stabilized by the lotus, and becomes the armor seal.

original: gsang ba'i gnod sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gnas su rdo rje thal mo'i rnam pas phyag rgya'i sbyor ba byas pa gang yin pa de ni gsang ba'i gnod sbyin gyi tshul du
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnod sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gnas su rdo rje thal mo'i rnam pas phyag rgya'i sbyor ba byas pa gang yin pa de ni gsang ba'i gnod sbyin gyi tshul du
translated: The so-called “secret yakṣa” and so on is the application of the seal in the form of the vajra-palms in the place of the vajra-yakṣa in the secret maṇḍala of the vajra realm.

original: zhes bya ba de bzhin du byas la brkyang nas rdo rje thal mo snyim pa'i tshul du byas pa khar bzhag na padmo gnod sbyin ma'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de bzhin du byas la brkyang nas rdo rje thal mo snyim pa'i tshul du byas pa khar bzhag na padmo gnod sbyin ma'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having done just that, extend the vajra palms, and place them in the mouth in the form of a cupped vajra palm; this becomes the gesture of Padma-yakṣa.

original: gsang ba'i gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya de yang rdo rje thal mo'i mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste rang gi mthe bo'i drung du bzhag la mthe bo gnyis kyang dbral bar bya ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya de yang rdo rje thal mo'i mdzub mo gnyis bkug ste rang gi mthe bo'i drung du bzhag la mthe bo gnyis kyang dbral bar bya ste /
translated: That gesture of the secret yakṣa is also the two vajra palms, with the two index fingers bent and placed near one’s thumbs, and the two thumbs also separated.

original: 'di ni gsang ba'i gnod sbyin gyi tshul de 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gsang ba'i gnod sbyin gyi tshul de 'di yin no //
translated: This is the way of the secret yakṣa.

original: rdo rje khu tshur zhes bya ba la sog pa ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi phyag rgya las mdzub mo gnyis ji ltar gnas pa gung mo gnyis kyang de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur zhes bya ba la sog pa ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi phyag rgya las mdzub mo gnyis ji ltar gnas pa gung mo gnyis kyang de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: As for the vajra fist and so on, from the gesture of the vajra fist, the two index fingers are placed as they are, and the two middle fingers are also done the same way.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //🔽'di rdo rje khu tshur gyi gnas kyi padmo'i khu tshur gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o // 'di rdo rje khu tshur gyi gnas kyi padmo'i khu tshur gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The rest are easy to understand.🔽This is the gesture of the lotus fist of the abode of the vajra fist.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi tshul gyis ni //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi tshul gyis ni //
translated: By the method of the vajra realm,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por sgeg mo la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe bo gnyis @43a * //🔽drang por sbyar bar bya ste /🔽'di ni rdo rje dbyings kyi tshul de las 'dir rdo rje thal mo las mthe bo gnyis bsnyams la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por sgeg mo la sogs pa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe bo gnyis @43a * // drang por sbyar bar bya ste / 'di ni rdo rje dbyings kyi tshul de las 'dir rdo rje thal mo las mthe bo gnyis bsnyams la /
translated: Thus, in the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm, the pledge seal of Lāsyā and so forth is the vajra-binding with the two thumbs straight and joined.🔽This is the method of the vajra realm.

original: rdo rje sgeg mo la sogs pa'i phyag rgyar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sgeg mo la sogs pa'i phyag rgyar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the two thumbs are joined in the vajra-clasp, and applied to the seals of Vajralāsyā and so forth.

original: de ltar na rdo rje sgeg mo la sogs pa bzhi po rnams kyi ni rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe bo brkyang ba las phyag rgyar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na rdo rje sgeg mo la sogs pa bzhi po rnams kyi ni rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe bo brkyang ba las phyag rgyar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, for the four beginning with Vajralāsyā, the seal arises from the extended thumb of the vajra-binding.

original: bdug pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ni rdo rje bsdams pa kho na las te /🔽rdo rje bsdams pa thur du gtugs //
analyzed: bdug pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ni rdo rje bsdams pa kho na las te / rdo rje bsdams pa thur du gtugs //
translated: For Dhūpā and so forth, it is from the vajra-binding alone,🔽because it is said, “The vajra-binding is lowered,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and so forth.”

original: de skad gsungs pa las ni 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de skad gsungs pa las ni 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: This statement should be understood as follows.

original: sgeg mo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bzhi char yang der rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe bo brkyang ba las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sgeg mo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bzhi char yang der rdo rje bsdams pa'i mthe bo brkyang ba las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: All four seals such as the flirtatious one arise from the vajra-bound fist with the index finger extended.

original: de bzhin du 'dir sgeg mo la sogs pa bzhi char gyi yang rdo rje thal mo'i mthe bo bsnyams pa las dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir sgeg mo la sogs pa bzhi char gyi yang rdo rje thal mo'i mthe bo bsnyams pa las dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, here, all four seals such as the flirtatious one are applied as pledge seals from the vajra-bound fist with the index finger extended.

original: bdug pa la sogs pa ni rdo rje thal mo phye ba las yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bdug pa la sogs pa ni rdo rje thal mo phye ba las yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the incense and so forth are from the open vajra-bound palms.

original: 'di dag ni rdo rje dbyings kyi tshul te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rdo rje dbyings kyi tshul te /
translated: These are the methods of the vajra realm.

original: mchod pa'i mchog lha mo brgyad po thams cad kyis mchod pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i mchog lha mo brgyad po thams cad kyis mchod pa'o //
translated: The eight goddesses such as the flirtatious one are the supreme worship.

original: dam tshig mchog ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: dam tshig mchog ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: The supreme pledge is the pledge seal.

original: dam tshig kyang de yin la mchog kyang de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig kyang de yin la mchog kyang de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a pledge and it is supreme.

original: da ni sgo ba rnams kyi phyag rgya ston te /
analyzed: da ni sgo ba rnams kyi phyag rgya ston te /
translated: Now the seals of the gatekeepers are taught.

original: de la re zhig sgo dang por ni bcom ldan 'das rta mgrin padma lcags kyu yin la /
analyzed: de la re zhig sgo dang por ni bcom ldan 'das rta mgrin padma lcags kyu yin la /
translated: First, at the gate, the Blessed One Hayagrīva is the lotus hook.

original: de'i phyag rgya ni /
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya ni /
translated: His seal is:

original: rdo rje bsdams pa dam byas la //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa dam byas la //
translated: Having made the binding of the vajra fist,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: and so forth.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa dam du bcings la /🔽mdzub mo gnyis ni mnyam sbyar nas //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa dam du bcings la / mdzub mo gnyis ni mnyam sbyar nas //
translated: Having tightly bound the vajra fist,🔽one should join the two index fingers.

original: zhes bya ba la mnyam par sbyar bas na mnyam par sbyar te mdzub mo gnyis sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽bkug pa zhes bya ba la bkug pa ni tshigs par ma bcag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mnyam par sbyar bas na mnyam par sbyar te mdzub mo gnyis sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // bkug pa zhes bya ba la bkug pa ni tshigs par ma bcag pa'o //
translated: Having joined them, one should join the two index fingers. This is the meaning of having joined them.🔽 The bent [fingers] are those that are not bent at the joints.

original: rtse mo sbyar ba'i zhes bya ba ni rtse mo dgug pa'o //
analyzed: rtse mo sbyar ba'i zhes bya ba ni rtse mo dgug pa'o //
translated: The tips are the tips of the fingers.

original: 'di ni rta gdong lta bu yin te /🔽de la mthe bo gnyis ni rna bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ni rta gdong lta bu yin te / de la mthe bo gnyis ni rna bar 'gyur la /
translated: This is like the face of a horse,🔽where the two thumbs are the ears,

original: mthe'u chung zur du brkyang ba gnyis ni rje dar du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthe'u chung zur du brkyang ba gnyis ni rje dar du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the two little fingers extended to the sides are the nostrils.

original: gang gis phyag rgya 'di'i sbyor ba dang / bdag nyid spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi gzugs su bskyed la ma rungs pa thams cad gdul ba'i phyir spyi bor rta gdong gi phyag rgya rmi ga pa gnyis 'phyag ste byung ba bzhag cing /
analyzed: gang gis phyag rgya 'di'i sbyor ba dang / bdag nyid spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi gzugs su bskyed la ma rungs pa thams cad gdul ba'i phyir spyi bor rta gdong gi phyag rgya rmi ga pa gnyis 'phyag ste byung ba bzhag cing /
translated: One should visualize oneself as Avalokiteśvara, and in order to subdue all evildoers, one should visualize the hūṃ-marked horse face above one’s head, with the two eyes rolling around.

original: zhal rnam par 'gyur ba mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: zhal rnam par 'gyur ba mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: One should visualize oneself with a contorted face, baring one’s fangs,

original: zhal gdangs shing bskal pa'i me lce 'bar ba'i phreng ba kun du @43b 'khrugs pa /
analyzed: zhal gdangs shing bskal pa'i me lce 'bar ba'i phreng ba kun du @43b 'khrugs pa /
translated: one’s mouth agape, and a garland of flames of the fire of the end of the eon blazing all around,

original: 'jig rten gsum po ri bo rnams dang bcas pa dang rgya mtshor bcas pa za bzhin pa lta bur bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po ri bo rnams dang bcas pa dang rgya mtshor bcas pa za bzhin pa lta bur bdag nyid bsam par bya'o //
translated: as if one were devouring the three worlds with their mountains and oceans.

original: padmo thal mo mnyam sbyar la //
analyzed: padmo thal mo mnyam sbyar la //
translated: The lotus palms are joined together,

original: zhes bya ba ni padma kha ma bye ba lta bu'i thal mo sbyar la mdzub mo gnyis mdud par mdud pa ni zhes bya ba mdzub mo gnyis kyi gdong phan tshun du sprad de mdud pa'i tshul gyis padmo kha ma bye ba lta bur bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni padma kha ma bye ba lta bu'i thal mo sbyar la mdzub mo gnyis mdud par mdud pa ni zhes bya ba mdzub mo gnyis kyi gdong phan tshun du sprad de mdud pa'i tshul gyis padmo kha ma bye ba lta bur bya ste /
translated: The palms are joined like an unopened lotus, and the two index fingers are crossed in a knot.🔽

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das don yod zhags pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das don yod zhags pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudra of the Blessed Amogha-pasa.

original: da ni padmo'i lcags sgrog gi phyag rgya bstan par bya ba'i phyir mtheb mdzub lcags sgrog ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni padmo'i lcags sgrog gi phyag rgya bstan par bya ba'i phyir mtheb mdzub lcags sgrog ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the lotus-chain mudra, he says, “The chain of the thumbs and forefingers,” etc.

original: padmo kha ma bye ba'i phyag rgya de nyid las mthe bo gnyis dang mdzub mo gnyis gcig la gcig 'khyud par sbrel la lcags sgrog tu bya ba 'di ni padmo'i lcags sgrog gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: padmo kha ma bye ba'i phyag rgya de nyid las mthe bo gnyis dang mdzub mo gnyis gcig la gcig 'khyud par sbrel la lcags sgrog tu bya ba 'di ni padmo'i lcags sgrog gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: From that very lotus-bud mudra, the two thumbs and two forefingers should be joined together in mutual embrace, forming a chain. This is the lotus-chain mudra.

original: ma rungs pa thams cad ba cing ba la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma rungs pa thams cad ba cing ba la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be applied to the binding of all evildoers.

original: padmo'i thal mo mnyam byas la //
analyzed: padmo'i thal mo mnyam byas la //
translated: Having made the lotus-palms equal,

original: zhes bya ba ni padmo kham bye ba'i thal mo bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni padmo kham bye ba'i thal mo bya ba'o //
translated: This is the lotus-opening añjali.

original: mthe bo gnyis bcug dam du btsir //
analyzed: mthe bo gnyis bcug dam du btsir //
translated: The two thumbs are inserted and pressed firmly.

original: zhes bya ba ni srin lag dang mthe'u chung gnyis kyi bar du mthe bo'i lto btsir bar bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srin lag dang mthe'u chung gnyis kyi bar du mthe bo'i lto btsir bar bya ba'i don te /
translated: This means that the thumbs are inserted between the ring fingers and little fingers and pressed.

original: 'di ni padma dbab pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni padma dbab pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the lotus-descent seal.

original: padmo'i khu tshur 'di bshad zin te /
analyzed: padmo'i khu tshur 'di bshad zin te /
translated: This lotus fist has been explained.

original: de gnyis su byas la rdo rje dbyings las pa spyings bcas gsor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyi phyag rgya rnams bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis su byas la rdo rje dbyings las pa spyings bcas gsor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyi phyag rgya rnams bstan par bya'o //
translated: Having made those two, one should display the seals in the manner of the Vajradhātu maṇḍala, “raised in the air,” and so forth.

original: bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcing bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcing bar bya ba'o //
translated: “One should accomplish” means one should bind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi rigs kyi dam tshig yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dam tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi rigs kyi dam tshig yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dam tshig ste /
translated: Since it is the pledge of the Dharma of all the Tathāgatas, it is the Dharma pledge of all the Tathāgatas.

original: dam tshig la sogs pa'i cho gar yongs brtags pa yin pas na rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig la sogs pa'i cho gar yongs brtags pa yin pas na rtogs pa'o //
translated: Since it is imagined in the rite of the pledge and so forth, it is the realization.

original: rtog pa gzhan rnams las shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir rgyal po yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po ste /
analyzed: rtog pa gzhan rnams las shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir rgyal po yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na rtog pa'i rgyal po chen po ste /
translated: Since it is the king of all concepts, and since it is the great king, it is the great king of concepts.

original: de las 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba la dbang du byed pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po'o //
analyzed: de las 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba la dbang du byed pa'i dkyil 'khor chen po'o //
translated: From that, there is the great mandala of the subjugation of all migrating beings.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgya cher bshad pa ko sa la'i rgyan las 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'grel pa'o /🔽// / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas padma'i rigs kyi phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor ston to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgya cher bshad pa ko sa la'i rgyan las 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'grel pa'o / // / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas padma'i rigs kyi phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor ston to //
translated: This is the commentary on the subjugation of all migrating beings mandala from the Kosalālamkāra, the commentary on the Compendium of Principles.🔽Now, from “Then, having manifested this mandala of the great pledge of the lotus family, he spoke of the great pledge of the lotus family,” it teaches the mandala of the lotus family’s pledge seal.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni rjes thogs la ste phyag rgya chen po'i dkyil 'khor gyi rjes thogs la phyag @44a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni rjes thogs la ste phyag rgya chen po'i dkyil 'khor gyi rjes thogs la phyag @44a * //
translated: “Then” means subsequently, after the great seal mandala.

original: rgya'i dkyil 'khor ston pa'o //
analyzed: rgya'i dkyil 'khor ston pa'o //
translated: The mandala of the pledge seal is taught.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su rdo rje gsungs kyi dkyil 'khor la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su rdo rje gsungs kyi dkyil 'khor la ltos pa'o //
translated: “Again” means in relation to the Vajra Speech mandala of the Tathāgata family.

original: bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Since he has conquered the four demons, he is the Blessed One.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni dkyil 'khor pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni dkyil 'khor pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: All Tathagatas are the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the mandala.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan nyid der byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs su sbul par mdzad pas de dag thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan nyid der byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs su sbul par mdzad pas de dag thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Since the qualities of the Buddha are manifested in the form of Bodhisattvas, all of them are called Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi rigs kyi gzungs ma yin pas na chos kyi gzungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi rigs kyi gzungs ma yin pas na chos kyi gzungs te /
translated: Since it is the Dharma-dhara of all Tathagatas, it is the Dharma-dhara.

original: gzungs zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi gzungs yin par gzung la /
analyzed: gzungs zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi gzungs yin par gzung la /
translated: The term dhara should be understood as the mantra-dhara.

original: de dag gi dam tshig ni phyag rgya dang lha dang sngags dang / rigs pa dang snying po rnams ni dam tshig ces bya bar gzung bar bya'o //🔽de lta bu'i khyad par gyi dam tshig 'di /
analyzed: de dag gi dam tshig ni phyag rgya dang lha dang sngags dang / rigs pa dang snying po rnams ni dam tshig ces bya bar gzung bar bya'o // de lta bu'i khyad par gyi dam tshig 'di /
translated: Their commitments are the mudras, deities, mantras, reasonings, and essence mantras, which should be understood as commitments.

original: bsam pa'i khyad par gang las byung //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par gang las byung //
translated: From what special thought does this special commitment arise?

original: zhes padma'i bsgom pa las des par skyes pa'i bsam pa'i khyad par de byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gang padmo la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la ni don dang mthun pa'i ming 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos
analyzed: zhes padma'i bsgom pa las des par skyes pa'i bsam pa'i khyad par de byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gang padmo la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la ni don dang mthun pa'i ming 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos
translated: This is the samadhi that focuses on the lotus, the samadhi that is the name in accordance with the meaning of the consecration of the special attitude that is definitely generated from the meditation on the lotus.🔽

original: kyi gzungs kyi dam tshig 'byung ba'i byin gyi rlabs padma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
analyzed: kyi gzungs kyi dam tshig 'byung ba'i byin gyi rlabs padma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
translated: In order to bless the special attitude that is born from the meditation on the lotus, the samādhi that focuses on the lotus is called the samādhi that has the name “the blessing of the arising of the dhāraṇī of the Dharma of all tathāgatas.”

original: de bas na ming de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de bas na ming de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Therefore, he entered the samādhi called by that name.

original: nyid kyi dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlabs pa'i rig pa dam pa 'og nas bshad pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: nyid kyi dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlabs pa'i rig pa dam pa 'og nas bshad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: He then spoke this sublime knowledge that blesses his own maṇḍala, which will be explained below.

original: ji lta bcom ldan 'das kyis nyid kyi dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i rig pa dam pa gsungs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji lta bcom ldan 'das kyis nyid kyi dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i rig pa dam pa gsungs pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the Bhagavān spoke the sublime knowledge that blesses his own maṇḍala,

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i gnas na gnas pa'i phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa 'khor los sgyur ba bzhis kyang rang rang gi dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i gnas na gnas pa'i phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa 'khor los sgyur ba bzhis kyang rang rang gi dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The four wheel-holders such as Vajrapāṇi who reside in the abodes of Akṣobhya and so on also consecrate their own maṇḍalas.

original: dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob pa'i rig pa rnams gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor byin gyis rlob pa'i rig pa rnams gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The four cakravartins such as Vajrapāṇi who reside in the abodes of Akṣobhya and so forth, also proclaim the awareness mantras for the consecration of the maṇḍala in order to consecrate their own maṇḍalas.

original: 'dir 'khor los sgyur ba gzhan la'ang phyag na rdo rje'i sgrar gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir 'khor los sgyur ba gzhan la'ang phyag na rdo rje'i sgrar gsungs mod kyi /
translated: Here, although the other cakravartins are also called Vajrapāṇi,

original: 'on kyang 'gro ba 'dul ba de nyid kyi gzugs yin par ba lta'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gro ba 'dul ba de nyid kyi gzugs yin par ba lta'o //
translated: nevertheless, they are considered to be the forms of just that Lokanātha.

original: da ni phyag na rdo rje'i sgrar gsungs pa de nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug yin par bstan pa'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos zhes bya ba gsungs @44b pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni phyag na rdo rje'i sgrar gsungs pa de nyid 'jig rten dbang phyug yin par bstan pa'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos zhes bya ba gsungs @44b pa yin no //
translated: Now, in order to teach that the one called Vajrapāṇi is just Avalokiteśvara, he says, “Then the Lord Avalokiteśvara,” and so on.

original: rang gi rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi rigs ni padma'i rigs so //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi rigs ni padma'i rigs so //
translated: The maṇḍala of the pledge seal of one’s own family and so on. One’s own family is the lotus family.

original: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni dam tshig 'dzin du 'jug pa'i phyag rgya yin nga aa dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi phyag rgya ni dam tshig 'dzin du 'jug pa'i phyag rgya yin nga aa dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The pledge seal is the seal that causes one to take up the pledge, and the pledge seal is the pledge.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor yin pas na rang gi rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor te dkyil 'khor ni snying po la bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor yin pas na rang gi rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor te dkyil 'khor ni snying po la bya ste /
translated: Since it is the mandala of that, it is the mandala of the pledge seal of one's own lineage. The mandala is the essence,

original: mar gyi snying po bzhin no //
analyzed: mar gyi snying po bzhin no //
translated: like the essence of butter.

original: de 'dzin par byed pas na dkyil 'khor te manda ni snying po la ni a'a da na ste len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pas na dkyil 'khor te manda ni snying po la ni a'a da na ste len par byed pa'o //
translated: Since it holds that, it is the mandala. Mandala means essence, and āda means to take up.

original: sems can rnams kyi snying po ni skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni snying po yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi snying po ni skyabs su 'gro ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni snying po yin te /
translated: The essence of sentient beings is the refuge, the generation of the mind of enlightenment, and the accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: snying po de len pa la 'dzud pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying po de len pa la 'dzud pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That essence is taken up, and it is the meaning of “to enter.”

original: de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor de gsungs pa ni bshad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor de gsungs pa ni bshad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The teaching of such a mandala is the meaning of “to explain.”

original: ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: How is it taught?

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning with “then” teaches it.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni rjes thogs te dkyil 'khor chen po'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni rjes thogs te dkyil 'khor chen po'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Then, after the great maṇḍala,

original: padma'i rigs kyi phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor du gtogs pa'i don gyi bya ba de ma bstan na 'byung bar mi 'gyur na /🔽de'i phyir rab tu bshad bya ba //
analyzed: padma'i rigs kyi phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor du gtogs pa'i don gyi bya ba de ma bstan na 'byung bar mi 'gyur na / de'i phyir rab tu bshad bya ba //
translated: the meaning of the maṇḍala of the mudrā-consorts of the lotus family is not revealed, it will not arise.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: I will explain🔽the supreme maṇḍala of mudrās.

original: yang dag cing phyin ci ma log par rab tu phye zhing so sor gses te /🔽bstan par bya zhing bshad par bya ba yin pas na rab tu bshad bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag cing phyin ci ma log par rab tu phye zhing so sor gses te / bstan par bya zhing bshad par bya ba yin pas na rab tu bshad bya ba'o //
translated: Correctly and without error, I will explain and reveal🔽the supreme maṇḍala of mudrās.

original: ci zhig bshad ces na /
analyzed: ci zhig bshad ces na /
translated: What is explained?

original: phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The maṇḍala of mudrās is mentioned.

original: ji lta bu zhe na dam pa zhes bya ba ste don gyi mchog sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na dam pa zhes bya ba ste don gyi mchog sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: What is it like? It is supreme, because it accomplishes the highest goal.

original: ji ltar bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rdo rje dbyings dang 'dra ba la ste rdo rje dbyings dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings dang 'dra ba la ste rdo rje dbyings dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: It is like the vajra realm, similar to the vajra realm.

original: ming ji skad ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ming ji skad ces bya zhe na /
translated: What is its name?

original: padmo'i gsang bzhes bshad do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: padmo'i gsang bzhes bshad do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is explained as the secret lotus.

original: padma'i rigs kyi gsang ba yin pas na padmo'i gsang ba ste /
analyzed: padma'i rigs kyi gsang ba yin pas na padmo'i gsang ba ste /
translated: Since it is the secret of the lotus family, it is the lotus secret.

original: gsang bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: gsang bar grags pa'o //
translated: It is renowned as a secret.

original: dkyil 'khor de ji ltar thig gdab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de ji ltar thig gdab par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one lay out the mandala?

original: dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du ni //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du ni // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In the manner of the great mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po ni 'dir 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po ni 'dir 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The great mandala here is the mandala of the Subjugation of the Three Worlds.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po de sbyor ba gang dang / ting nge 'dzin gang dang dbyibs gang gis theg 'debs par byed pa'i sbyong ba de nyid dang / ting nge 'dzin de nyid dang dbyibs de nyid kyis 'dir yang thig gdab par bya'o //🔽de zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor @45a * //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po de sbyor ba gang dang / ting nge 'dzin gang dang dbyibs gang gis theg 'debs par byed pa'i sbyong ba de nyid dang / ting nge 'dzin de nyid dang dbyibs de nyid kyis 'dir yang thig gdab par bya'o // de zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor @45a * //
translated: With the same yoga, the same samadhi, and the same shape as the one by which the great mandala is laid out, one should lay out the lines here as well.🔽The same means the same as the great mandala.

original: chen po'i'o // dbus zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad ki gnas su'o //
analyzed: chen po'i'o // dbus zhes bya ba ni rnam par snang mdzad ki gnas su'o //
translated: The center is the place of Vairochana.

original: padmo bzang po ni padma mchog ste padmo'i gtso bo'o //
analyzed: padmo bzang po ni padma mchog ste padmo'i gtso bo'o //
translated: The excellent lotus is the supreme lotus, the chief lotus.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang mo bri //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang mo bri //
translated: One should draw the Vajradhatviśvarī.

original: zhes bya ba ni mchod rten la legs par zhugs par bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchod rten la legs par zhugs par bri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one should draw the mandala in the form of a caitya.

original: mchod rten khri la legs 'dug pa //
analyzed: mchod rten khri la legs 'dug pa //
translated: Seated on a caitya throne,

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang mor bshad //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang mor bshad //
translated: she is called Vajradhatviśvarī.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because she is the supreme of all the pledges, and because she is the supreme of all the seals.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang mo'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang mo'i'o //
translated: Her means of Vajradhatviśvarī.

original: phyogs rnams thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi char du'o //
analyzed: phyogs rnams thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi char du'o //
translated: In all directions means in all four directions.

original: dam tshig rnams ni phyag rgya thams cad do //
analyzed: dam tshig rnams ni phyag rgya thams cad do //
translated: Pledges are all the seals.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ni sems dpa' rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rigs kyi yum rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ni sems dpa' rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rigs kyi yum rnams so //
translated: The supreme of those is the consorts of the families, such as Sattvavajri.

original: lhag ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor chen po bzhin du'o //🔽rang gi rig pa rnams ldan par //
analyzed: lhag ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor chen po bzhin du'o // rang gi rig pa rnams ldan par //
translated: The rest is like the great maṇḍala.🔽Endowed with one’s own awareness

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi rig pa rnams kyis dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽chos kyi rdo rje la sogs pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi rig pa rnams kyis dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // chos kyi rdo rje la sogs pa //
translated: means that one should arrange one’s own awarenesses.🔽Dharmadhātvīśvarī, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la chos kyi rdo rje ma zhes smos pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la chos kyi rdo rje ma zhes smos pas /
translated: The mention of Dharmadhātvīśvarī

original: sems dpa' rdo rje nyid yin par ston par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' rdo rje nyid yin par ston par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that this teaches that the bodhisattva is Vajradhara himself.🔽

original: 'di nyid dkyil 'khor 'dir dam tshig gi phyag rgya yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid dkyil 'khor 'dir dam tshig gi phyag rgya yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the Bodhisattva Vajra is taught to be the pledge seal in this maṇḍala.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor der ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor der ro //
translated: “ In that” means in that secret maṇḍala.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni gsang ba'i phyag rgya de rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni gsang ba'i phyag rgya de rnams kyi'o //
translated: “ Of them” means of those secret seals.

original: phyag rgya ni 'di rnams yin no zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya rnams kyi dgod pa'i snying po la phyag rgya'i sgrar gsung te /
analyzed: phyag rgya ni 'di rnams yin no zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya rnams kyi dgod pa'i snying po la phyag rgya'i sgrar gsung te /
translated: “ The seals are these” means that the essence of the arrangement of the seals is called the seal sound.

original: rig pa de dag nyid las phyag rgya rnams 'byung bas tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa de dag nyid las phyag rgya rnams 'byung bas tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seals are not different from those very awarenesses, they arise from them.

original: sems dpa' rdo rje la sogs pa'i rig pa bstan zin nas /
analyzed: sems dpa' rdo rje la sogs pa'i rig pa bstan zin nas /
translated: Having taught the awarenesses of Bodhisattva Vajra and so forth,

original: sna tshogs gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rig pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rig pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: the “various forms” and so forth teach the awarenesses of the maṇḍalas of Akṣobhya and so forth.

original: rdo rje shugs ni dam tshig las mi 'da' ba'i sngags te /
analyzed: rdo rje shugs ni dam tshig las mi 'da' ba'i sngags te /
translated: The “vajra speed” is the mantra of not transgressing the pledge.

original: srad bu la sogs pa las rgal kyang ri mo'am thig yid kyis gyen du btegs la sngags pa 'og nas 'dzul na nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni yid kyi phyag rgya dang bcas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: srad bu la sogs pa las rgal kyang ri mo'am thig yid kyis gyen du btegs la sngags pa 'og nas 'dzul na nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni yid kyi phyag rgya dang bcas par bshad zin to //
translated: Even if one crosses over the thread and so on, if one raises the line or the thread mentally, and enters below the mantra, there is no fault. This is explained as being endowed with the mental seal.

original: des / rdo rje shugs kyis rgan na ni //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des / rdo rje shugs kyis rgan na ni // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If one crosses over with the vajra speed,🔽then one should go to the mandala of Akshobhya.

original: sngags dang phyag rgya'i chogs brgal nas mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya'i chogs brgal nas mi bskyod pa'i dkyil 'khor du 'gro ba ste /
translated: Having crossed over with the mantra and seal ritual, one should go to the mandala of Akshobhya.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du 'gro ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du 'gro ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not go outside the mandala.

original: sna tshogs ni gzugs thams cad yang @45b dag par ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
analyzed: sna tshogs ni gzugs thams cad yang @45b dag par ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug go //
translated: The various is the Bhagavat Lokeshvara, who is in the samadhi of showing all forms.

original: de'i mchog dkyil 'khor ni dkyil 'khor dbus ma'o //
analyzed: de'i mchog dkyil 'khor ni dkyil 'khor dbus ma'o //
translated: The best mandala is the central mandala.

original: de'i dbus su zhes bya ba ni dbus ma'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su zhes bya ba ni dbus ma'i gnas su'o //
translated: The in the middle is in the middle place.

original: padmos bskor ba'i padmo bri bar ya //
analyzed: padmos bskor ba'i padmo bri bar ya //
translated: One should draw a lotus surrounded by lotuses.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: dkyil 'khor dbus ma'i dbus su padma gtso bo bris la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dbus ma'i dbus su padma gtso bo bris la /
translated: In the center of the mandala, draw the principal lotus.

original: yang padma chung du rnams kyis yongs su bskor la kun nas zlum po'i tshul du gnas par bri'o //
analyzed: yang padma chung du rnams kyis yongs su bskor la kun nas zlum po'i tshul du gnas par bri'o //
translated: Then, surrounding it with smaller lotuses, draw it in the form of a complete circle.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni padma'i dkyil 'khor gyi logs rnams su'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni padma'i dkyil 'khor gyi logs rnams su'o //
translated: “ In that” means in the spaces of the lotus mandala.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi char du'o //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi char du'o //
translated: “ Everywhere” means in all four directions.

original: padma'i phyag rgya nyid gnas pa zhes bya ba ni padmo'i gdan no //🔽padmo'i mtshan ma bri bar bya //
analyzed: padma'i phyag rgya nyid gnas pa zhes bya ba ni padmo'i gdan no // padmo'i mtshan ma bri bar bya //
translated: “ The abode of the lotus seal” means the lotus seat.

original: zhes bya ba ni padmo'i mtshan ma gang la yod pa de dag ni padma'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni padmo'i mtshan ma gang la yod pa de dag ni padma'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: “ Draw the lotus sign” means those that have the lotus sign.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag rgya padma la gnas par sngar ma bshad du zin kyang /
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag rgya padma la gnas par sngar ma bshad du zin kyang /
translated: Although the vajra and other seals were not previously explained as abiding in the lotus,
